00001                         /* Sparse matrices in compressed column-oriented form */
00002 #include "Csparse.h"
00003 #include "Tsparse.h"
00004 #include "chm_common.h"

00006 SEXP Csparse_validate(SEXP x)
00007 {
00008     /* NB: we do *NOT* check a potential 'x' slot here, at all */
00009     SEXP pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym),
00010         islot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym);
00011     Rboolean sorted, strictly;
00012     int j, k,
00013         *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)),
00014         nrow = dims[0],
00015         ncol = dims[1],
00016         *xp = INTEGER(pslot),
00017         *xi = INTEGER(islot);
00018 
00019     if (length(pslot) != dims[1] + 1)
00020         return mkString(_("slot p must have length = ncol(.) + 1"));
00021     if (xp[0] != 0)
00022         return mkString(_("first element of slot p must be zero"));
00023     if (length(islot) < xp[ncol]) /* allow larger slots from over-allocation!*/
00024         return
00025             mkString(_("last element of slot p must match length of slots i and x"));
00026     for (j = 0; j < xp[ncol]; j++) {
00027         if (xi[j] < 0 || xi[j] >= nrow)
00028             return mkString(_("all row indices must be between 0 and nrow-1"));
00029     }
00030     sorted = TRUE; strictly = TRUE;
00031     for (j = 0; j < ncol; j++) {
00032         if (xp[j] > xp[j + 1])
00033             return mkString(_("slot p must be non-decreasing"));
00034         if(sorted) /* only act if >= 2 entries in column j : */
00035             for (k = xp[j] + 1; k < xp[j + 1]; k++) {
00036                 if (xi[k] < xi[k - 1])
00037                     sorted = FALSE;
00038                 else if (xi[k] == xi[k - 1])
00039                     strictly = FALSE;
00040             }
00041     }
00042     if (!sorted) {
00043         CHM_SP chx = (CHM_SP) alloca(sizeof(cholmod_sparse));
00044         R_CheckStack();
00045         as_cholmod_sparse(chx, x, FALSE, TRUE); /* includes cholmod_sort() ! */
00046         /* as chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x)  but  ^^^^  sorting x in_place (no copying)*/
00047 
00048         /* Now re-check that row indices are *strictly* increasing
00049          * (and not just increasing) within each column : */
00050         for (j = 0; j < ncol; j++) {
00051             for (k = xp[j] + 1; k < xp[j + 1]; k++)
00052                 if (xi[k] == xi[k - 1])
00053                     return mkString(_("slot i is not *strictly* increasing inside a column (even after cholmod_sort)"));
00054         }
00055 
00056     } else if(!strictly) {  /* sorted, but not strictly */
00057         return mkString(_("slot i is not *strictly* increasing inside a column"));
00058     }
00059     return ScalarLogical(1);
00060 }
00061 
00062 SEXP Rsparse_validate(SEXP x)
00063 {
00064     /* NB: we do *NOT* check a potential 'x' slot here, at all */
00065     SEXP pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym),
00066         jslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym);
00067     Rboolean sorted, strictly;
00068     int i, k,
00069         *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)),
00070         nrow = dims[0],
00071         ncol = dims[1],
00072         *xp = INTEGER(pslot),
00073         *xj = INTEGER(jslot);
00074 
00075     if (length(pslot) != dims[0] + 1)
00076         return mkString(_("slot p must have length = nrow(.) + 1"));
00077     if (xp[0] != 0)
00078         return mkString(_("first element of slot p must be zero"));
00079     if (length(jslot) < xp[nrow]) /* allow larger slots from over-allocation!*/
00080         return
00081             mkString(_("last element of slot p must match length of slots j and x"));
00082     for (i = 0; i < length(jslot); i++) {
00083         if (xj[i] < 0 || xj[i] >= ncol)
00084             return mkString(_("all column indices must be between 0 and ncol-1"));
00085     }
00086     sorted = TRUE; strictly = TRUE;
00087     for (i = 0; i < nrow; i++) {
00088         if (xp[i] > xp[i+1])
00089             return mkString(_("slot p must be non-decreasing"));
00090         if(sorted)
00091             for (k = xp[i] + 1; k < xp[i + 1]; k++) {
00092                 if (xj[k] < xj[k - 1])
00093                     sorted = FALSE;
00094                 else if (xj[k] == xj[k - 1])
00095                     strictly = FALSE;
00096             }
00097     }
00098     if (!sorted)
00099         /* cannot easily use cholmod_sort(.) ... -> "error out" :*/
00100         return mkString(_("slot j is not increasing inside a column"));
00101     else if(!strictly) /* sorted, but not strictly */
00102         return mkString(_("slot j is not *strictly* increasing inside a column"));
00103 
00104     return ScalarLogical(1);
00105 }

00111 SEXP Csparse_to_dense(SEXP x)
00112 {
00113     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00114     /* This loses the symmetry property, since cholmod_dense has none,
00115      * BUT, much worse (FIXME!), it also transforms CHOLMOD_PATTERN ("n") matrices
00116      * to numeric (CHOLMOD_REAL) ones : */
00117     CHM_DN chxd = cholmod_sparse_to_dense(chxs, &c);
00118     int Rkind = (chxs->xtype == CHOLMOD_PATTERN)? -1 : Real_kind(x);
00119     R_CheckStack();
00120 
00121     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chxd, 1, Rkind, GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00122 }

00124 SEXP Csparse_to_nz_pattern(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00125 {
00126     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00127     CHM_SP chxcp = cholmod_copy(chxs, chxs->stype, CHOLMOD_PATTERN, &c);
00128     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00129     R_CheckStack();
00130 
00131     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chxcp, 1/*do_free*/,
00132                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00133                               0, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00134                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00135 }

00137 SEXP Csparse_to_matrix(SEXP x)
00138 {
00139     return chm_dense_to_matrix(cholmod_sparse_to_dense(AS_CHM_SP__(x), &c),
00140                                1 /*do_free*/, GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));

00143 SEXP Csparse_to_Tsparse(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00144 {
00145     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);

00147     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00148     int Rkind = (chxs->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00149     R_CheckStack();
00150 
00151     return chm_triplet_to_SEXP(chxt, 1,
00152                                tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00153                                Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00154                                GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));

00157 /* this used to be called  sCMatrix_to_gCMatrix(..)   [in ./dsCMatrix.c ]: */
00158 SEXP Csparse_symmetric_to_general(SEXP x)
00159 {
00160     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chgx;
00161     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00162     R_CheckStack();
00163 
00164     if (!(chx->stype))
00165         error(_("Nonsymmetric matrix in Csparse_symmetric_to_general"));
00166     chgx = cholmod_copy(chx, /* stype: */ 0, chx->xtype, &c);
00167     /* xtype: pattern, "real", complex or .. */
00168     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chgx, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00169                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00170 }

00172 SEXP Csparse_general_to_symmetric(SEXP x, SEXP uplo)
00173 {
00174     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chgx;
00175     int uploT = (*CHAR(STRING_ELT(uplo,0)) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00176     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00177     R_CheckStack();
00178 
00179     chgx = cholmod_copy(chx, /* stype: */ uploT, chx->xtype, &c);
00180     /* xtype: pattern, "real", complex or .. */
00181     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chgx, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00182                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00183 }

00185 SEXP Csparse_transpose(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00186 {
00187     /* TODO: lgCMatrix & igC* currently go via double prec. cholmod -
00188      *       since cholmod (& cs) lacks sparse 'int' matrices */
00189     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00190     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00191     CHM_SP chxt = cholmod_transpose(chx, chx->xtype, &c);
00192     SEXP dn = PROTECT(duplicate(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym))), tmp;
00193     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00194     R_CheckStack();
00195 
00196     tmp = VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0);    /* swap the dimnames */
00197     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0, VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1));
00198     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1, tmp);
00199     UNPROTECT(1);
00200     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chxt, 1, /* SWAP 'uplo' for triangular */
00201                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? -1 : 1) : 0,
00202                               Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "", dn);
00203 }
00204 
00205 SEXP Csparse_Csparse_prod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00206 {
00207     CHM_SP
00208         cha = AS_CHM_SP(a),
00209         chb = AS_CHM_SP(b),
00210         chc = cholmod_ssmult(cha, chb, /*out_stype:*/ 0,
00211                              cha->xtype, /*out sorted:*/ 1, &c);
00212     const char *cl_a = class_P(a), *cl_b = class_P(b);
00213     char diag[] = {'\0', '\0'};
00214     int uploT = 0;
00215     SEXP dn = allocVector(VECSXP, 2);
00216     R_CheckStack();
00217 
00218     /* Preserve triangularity and even unit-triangularity if appropriate.
00219      * Note that in that case, the multiplication itself should happen
00220      * faster.  But there's no support for that in CHOLMOD */
00221 
00222     /* UGLY hack -- rather should have (fast!) C-level version of
00223      *       is(a, "triangularMatrix") etc */
00224     if (cl_a[1] == 't' && cl_b[1] == 't')
00225         /* FIXME: fails for "Cholesky","BunchKaufmann"..*/
00226         if(*uplo_P(a) == *uplo_P(b)) { /* both upper, or both lower tri. */
00227             uploT = (*uplo_P(a) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00228             if(*diag_P(a) == 'U' && *diag_P(b) == 'U') { /* return UNIT-triag. */
00229                 /* "remove the diagonal entries": */
00230                 chm_diagN2U(chc, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00231                 diag[0]= 'U';
00232             }
00233             else diag[0]= 'N';
00234         }
00235     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00236                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 0)));
00237     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00238                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00239     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chc, 1, uploT, /*Rkind*/0, diag, dn);
00240 }
00241 
00242 SEXP Csparse_Csparse_crossprod(SEXP a, SEXP b, SEXP trans)
00243 {
00244     int tr = asLogical(trans);
00245     CHM_SP
00246         cha = AS_CHM_SP(a),
00247         chb = AS_CHM_SP(b),
00248         chTr, chc;
00249     const char *cl_a = class_P(a), *cl_b = class_P(b);
00250     char diag[] = {'\0', '\0'};
00251     int uploT = 0;
00252     SEXP dn = allocVector(VECSXP, 2);
00253     R_CheckStack();
00254 
00255     chTr = cholmod_transpose((tr) ? chb : cha, chb->xtype, &c);
00256     chc = cholmod_ssmult((tr) ? cha : chTr, (tr) ? chTr : chb,
00257                          /*out_stype:*/ 0, cha->xtype, /*out sorted:*/ 1, &c);
00258     cholmod_free_sparse(&chTr, &c);
00259 
00260     /* Preserve triangularity and unit-triangularity if appropriate;
00261      * see Csparse_Csparse_prod() for comments */
00262     if (cl_a[1] == 't' && cl_b[1] == 't')
00263         if(*uplo_P(a) != *uplo_P(b)) { /* one 'U', the other 'L' */
00264             uploT = (*uplo_P(b) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00265             if(*diag_P(a) == 'U' && *diag_P(b) == 'U') { /* return UNIT-triag. */
00266                 chm_diagN2U(chc, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00267                 diag[0]= 'U';
00268             }
00269             else diag[0]= 'N';
00270         }
00271 
00272     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00273                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00274     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00275                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_DimNamesSym), (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00276     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chc, 1, uploT, /*Rkind*/0, diag, dn);
00277 }
00278 
00279 SEXP Csparse_dense_prod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00280 {
00281     CHM_SP cha = AS_CHM_SP(a);
00282     SEXP b_M = PROTECT(mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b));
00283     CHM_DN chb = AS_CHM_DN(b_M);
00284     CHM_DN chc = cholmod_allocate_dense(cha->nrow, chb->ncol, cha->nrow,
00285                                         chb->xtype, &c);
00286     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00287     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0};
00288     R_CheckStack();
00289 
00290     cholmod_sdmult(cha, 0, one, zero, chb, chc, &c);
00291     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00292                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 0)));
00293     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00294                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b_M, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00295     UNPROTECT(2);
00296     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chc, 1, 0, dn);
00297 }
00298 
00299 SEXP Csparse_dense_crossprod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00300 {
00301     CHM_SP cha = AS_CHM_SP(a);
00302     SEXP b_M = PROTECT(mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b));
00303     CHM_DN chb = AS_CHM_DN(b_M);
00304     CHM_DN chc = cholmod_allocate_dense(cha->ncol, chb->ncol, cha->ncol,
00305                                         chb->xtype, &c);
00306     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00307     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0};
00308     R_CheckStack();
00309 
00310     cholmod_sdmult(cha, 1, one, zero, chb, chc, &c);
00311     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00312                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00313     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00314                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b_M, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00315     UNPROTECT(2);
00316     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chc, 1, 0, dn);
00317 }
00318 
00319 /* Computes   x'x  or  x x' -- *also* for Tsparse (triplet = TRUE)
00320    see Csparse_Csparse_crossprod above for  x'y and x y' */
00321 SEXP Csparse_crossprod(SEXP x, SEXP trans, SEXP triplet)
00322 {
00323     int trip = asLogical(triplet),
00324         tr   = asLogical(trans); /* gets reversed because _aat is tcrossprod */
00325     CHM_TR cht = trip ? AS_CHM_TR(x) : (CHM_TR) NULL;
00326     CHM_SP chcp, chxt,
00327         chx = (trip ?
00328                cholmod_triplet_to_sparse(cht, cht->nnz, &c) :
00329                AS_CHM_SP(x));
00330     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00331     R_CheckStack();
00332 
00333     if (!tr) chxt = cholmod_transpose(chx, chx->xtype, &c);
00334     chcp = cholmod_aat((!tr) ? chxt : chx, (int *) NULL, 0, chx->xtype, &c);
00335     if(!chcp) {
00336         UNPROTECT(1);
00337         error(_("Csparse_crossprod(): error return from cholmod_aat()"));
00338     }
00339     cholmod_band_inplace(0, chcp->ncol, chcp->xtype, chcp, &c);
00340     chcp->stype = 1;
00341     if (trip) cholmod_free_sparse(&chx, &c);
00342     if (!tr) cholmod_free_sparse(&chxt, &c);
00343     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00344                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym),
00345                                         (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00346     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1, duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0)));
00347     UNPROTECT(1);
00348     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chcp, 1, 0, 0, "", dn);
00349 }
00350 
00351 SEXP Csparse_drop(SEXP x, SEXP tol)
00352 {
00353     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00354     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00355     int tr = (cl[1] == 't');
00356     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00357     CHM_SP ans = cholmod_copy(chx, chx->stype, chx->xtype, &c);
00358     double dtol = asReal(tol);
00359     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00360     R_CheckStack();
00361 
00362     if(!cholmod_drop(dtol, ans, &c))
00363         error(_("cholmod_drop() failed"));
00364     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1,
00365                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00366                               Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00367                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00368 }

00378                               1, 0, Rkind, "", R_NilValue);

00392 SEXP Csparse_band(SEXP x, SEXP k1, SEXP k2)
00393 {
00394     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00395     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00396     CHM_SP ans = cholmod_band(chx, asInteger(k1), asInteger(k2), chx->xtype, &c);
00397     R_CheckStack();
00398 
00399     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00400                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00401 }
00402 
00403 SEXP Csparse_diagU2N(SEXP x)
00404 {
00405     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00406     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00407     if (cl[1] != 't' || *diag_P(x) != 'U') {
00408         /* "trivially fast" when not triangular (<==> no 'diag' slot),
00409            or not *unit* triangular */
00410         return (x);
00411     }
00412     else { /* unit triangular (diag='U'): "fill the diagonal" & diag:= "N" */
00413         CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00414         CHM_SP eye = cholmod_speye(chx->nrow, chx->ncol, chx->xtype, &c);
00415         double one[] = {1, 0};
00416         CHM_SP ans = cholmod_add(chx, eye, one, one, TRUE, TRUE, &c);
00417         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00418         int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00419 
00420         R_CheckStack();
00421         cholmod_free_sparse(&eye, &c);
00422         return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1, uploT, Rkind, "N",
00423                                   GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00424     }
00425 }
00426 
00427 SEXP Csparse_diagN2U(SEXP x)
00428 {
00429     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00430     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00431     if (cl[1] != 't' || *diag_P(x) != 'N') {
00432         /* "trivially fast" when not triangular (<==> no 'diag' slot),
00433            or already *unit* triangular */
00434         return (x);
00435     }
00436     else { /* triangular with diag='N'): now drop the diagonal */
00437         /* duplicate, since chx will be modified: */
00438         CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(duplicate(x));
00439         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1,
00440             Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00441         R_CheckStack();
00442 
00443         chm_diagN2U(chx, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00444 
00445         return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chx, /*dofree*/ 0/* or 1 ?? */,
00446                                   uploT, Rkind, "U",
00447                                   GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00448     }
00449 }
00450 
00451 SEXP Csparse_submatrix(SEXP x, SEXP i, SEXP j)
00452 {
00453     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00454     int rsize = (isNull(i)) ? -1 : LENGTH(i),
00455         csize = (isNull(j)) ? -1 : LENGTH(j);
00456     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00457     R_CheckStack();
00458 
00459     if (rsize >= 0 && !isInteger(i))
00460         error(_("Index i must be NULL or integer"));
00461     if (csize >= 0 && !isInteger(j))
00462         error(_("Index j must be NULL or integer"));
00463 
00464     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(cholmod_submatrix(chx, INTEGER(i), rsize,
00465                                                 INTEGER(j), csize,
00466                                                 TRUE, TRUE, &c),
00467                               1, 0, Rkind, "",
00468                               /* FIXME: drops dimnames */ R_NilValue);
00469 }
00470 
00471 SEXP Csparse_MatrixMarket(SEXP x, SEXP fname)
00472 {
00473     FILE *f = fopen(CHAR(asChar(fname)), "w");
00474 
00475     if (!f)
00476         error(_("failure to open file \"%s\" for writing"),
00477               CHAR(asChar(fname)));
00478     if (!cholmod_write_sparse(f, AS_CHM_SP(x),
00479                               (CHM_SP)NULL, (char*) NULL, &c))
00480         error(_("cholmod_write_sparse returned error code"));
00481     fclose(f);
00482     return R_NilValue;
00483 }
00484 
00485 
00498 SEXP diag_tC_ptr(int n, int *x_p, double *x_x, int *perm, SEXP resultKind)
00499 /*                                ^^^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] to int / ... */
00500 {
00501     const char* res_ch = CHAR(STRING_ELT(resultKind,0));
00502     enum diag_kind { diag, diag_backpermuted, trace, prod, sum_log
00503     } res_kind = ((!strcmp(res_ch, "trace")) ? trace :
00504                   ((!strcmp(res_ch, "sumLog")) ? sum_log :
00505                    ((!strcmp(res_ch, "prod")) ? prod :
00506                     ((!strcmp(res_ch, "diag")) ? diag :
00507                      ((!strcmp(res_ch, "diagBack")) ? diag_backpermuted :
00508                       -1)))));
00509     int i, n_x, i_from = 0;
00510     SEXP ans = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP,
00511 /*                                 ^^^^  FIXME[Generalize] */
00512                                    (res_kind == diag ||
00513                                     res_kind == diag_backpermuted) ? n : 1));
00514     double *v = REAL(ans);
00515 /*  ^^^^^^      ^^^^  FIXME[Generalize] */
00516 
00517 #define for_DIAG(v_ASSIGN)                                              \
00518     for(i = 0; i < n; i++, i_from += n_x) {                             \
00519         /* looking at i-th column */                                    \
00520         n_x = x_p[i+1] - x_p[i];/* #{entries} in this column */ \
00521         v_ASSIGN;                                                       \
00522     }
00523 
00524     /* NOTA BENE: we assume  -- uplo = "L" i.e. lower triangular matrix
00525      *            for uplo = "U" (makes sense with a "dtCMatrix" !),
00526      *            should use  x_x[i_from + (nx - 1)] instead of x_x[i_from],
00527      *            where nx = (x_p[i+1] - x_p[i])
00528      */
00529 
00530     switch(res_kind) {
00531     case trace:
00532         v[0] = 0.;
00533         for_DIAG(v[0] += x_x[i_from]);
00534         break;
00535 
00536     case sum_log:
00537         v[0] = 0.;
00538         for_DIAG(v[0] += log(x_x[i_from]));
00539         break;
00540 
00541     case prod:
00542         v[0] = 1.;
00543         for_DIAG(v[0] *= x_x[i_from]);
00544         break;
00545 
00546     case diag:
00547         for_DIAG(v[i] = x_x[i_from]);
00548         break;
00549 
00550     case diag_backpermuted:
00551         for_DIAG(v[i] = x_x[i_from]);
00552 
00553         warning(_("resultKind = 'diagBack' (back-permuted) is experimental"));
00554         /* now back_permute : */
00555         for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00556             double tmp = v[i]; v[i] = v[perm[i]]; v[perm[i]] = tmp;
00557             /*^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] */
00558         }
00559         break;
00560 
00561     default: /* -1 from above */
00562         error("diag_tC(): invalid 'resultKind'");
00563         /* Wall: */ ans = R_NilValue; v = REAL(ans);
00564     }
00565 
00566     UNPROTECT(1);
00567     return ans;
00568 }
00569 
00582 SEXP diag_tC(SEXP pslot, SEXP xslot, SEXP perm_slot, SEXP resultKind)
00583 {
00584     int n = length(pslot) - 1, /* n = ncol(.) = nrow(.) */
00585         *x_p  = INTEGER(pslot),
00586         *perm = INTEGER(perm_slot);
00587     double *x_x = REAL(xslot);
00588 /*  ^^^^^^        ^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] to INTEGER(.) / LOGICAL(.) / ... xslot !*/
00589 
00590     return diag_tC_ptr(n, x_p, x_x, perm, resultKind);
00591 }
